page.title: 03Normanby Hall
page.content: The present mansion is at least the sixth'Normanby Hall'to be built on or near this site and was erected in Regency style by Sir Robert Smirke,one of the early-19th-century's most prolific designers,between 1820 and 1830 for Sir Robert Sheffield,4th Baronet.The house contains some good examples of furniture by Gillow of Lancaster and works of art of the Regency period.Scunthorpe Corporation has set about restoring and furnishing the rooms in early 19th century character,helped by contemporary inventories dated 1829 and 1840.To create a'lived-in' atmosphere things such as barriers,notices and ropes across chairs have been eliminated.The visitor will see contemporary books and newspapers,fruit and flowers in summer and log fires in winter.
